Codo » Index » Lemonette » BaseController

Class: Lemonette.BaseController

Defined in: app/scripts/application/controllers/base_controller.coffee
Inherits: Marionette.Controller

Overview

Base controller enables a single instance of each Controller to improve memory allocation. The creation of an instance of BaseController needs pass through an instance of Lemonette.ControllersModule to ensure an instance of LemonetteApplication inside.

Examples:

Create a instance of BaseController 

App = new Lemonette.Application
controller = new App.Controllers.BaseController

See also:

  • Marionette.Controller

Instance Method Summary

  • # (void) close() This override invokes the App.execute "unregister:instance"
  • # (void) show(view, options = {}) Show view in the current (or custom) region
  • # (void) _setMainView(view) Private the first view we show is always going to become the mainView of our controller (whether its a layout or another view type).
  • # (void) _manageView(view, options) Private Decide whether to display the view or show another view while loading the model/collection

Constructor Details

# (void) constructor(options = {})

is requested to AppInstance: App.request "default:region"

Parameters:

  • options ( Object )

Options Hash: (options):

  • region: ( Marionette.Region ) — is the region where the main view is rendered, the default region
  • loading: ( Boolean ) — sets if you need to provide a generic view of "loading"

See also:

  • Marionette.Region

Instance Method Details

# (void) close()

This override invokes the App.execute "unregister:instance"

# (void) show(view, options = {})

Show view in the current (or custom) region

Parameters:

  • view ( Lemonette.View ) — instance to show
  • options ( Object )

Options Hash: (options):

  • loading ( Boolean ) — sets if you need to provide a generic view of "loading"
  • region ( Marionette.Region ) — where we render the view

See also:

  • Marionette.Region

# (void) _setMainView(view) Private

the first view we show is always going to become the mainView of our controller (whether its a layout or another view type). So if this is a layout, when we show other regions inside of that layout, we check for the existance of a mainView first, so our controller is only closed down when the original mainView is closed.

# (void) _manageView(view, options) Private

Decide whether to display the view or show another view while loading the model/collection
